noun.description: A small stack of corn, hay, or straw.

origin: Early 17th century. Apparently from the unattested Norn reflex (with loss of the final consonant) of the early Scandinavian word represented by Old Icelandic skrúf haycock, corn-rick, Old Norwegian skrúfr top (Norwegian (Nynorsk) skruv (also regional skru) top part of something, corn-rick, stack of turf, woman's ornamental headdress), Old Swedish skruver bishop's mitre (Swedish regional skruv, applied to various cone-shaped objects), Danish regional skrue corn-rick, stack of turf, of uncertain origin.
